Pre-Lecture 8 Reading Before the lecture you should read: 7.2.4 Consistent Estimators 7.2.5 Robust Estimators 7.3 Point Estimation Techniques 7.3.1 Method of Moments Estimators

Example 7-9 Use R, either via RStudio on your own device or this online console. Enter your answers in this Google form. # This code may be useful (you need to replace the _ with numerical expressions and may need to copy and modify some code) stem1 <- c(1.7, 2.8, 3.2, 3.4, 5.3, 5.9, 6.2, 7.2, 8.3, 9.3) mean(_) sqrt(var(_)) median(_) mad(_, constant = 1) Show the solution # Create two samples (original and with error) stem1 <- c(1.7, 2.8, 3.2, 3.4, 5.3, 5.9, 6.2, 7.2, 8.3, 9.3) stem2 <- c(1.7, 2.8, 3.2, 3.4, 5.3, 5.9, 6.2, 7.2, 83, 9.3) # Sample mean and sample variance of original sample c(mean(stem1), sqrt(var(stem1))) [1] 5.330000 2.516634 # Sample mean and sample variance of sample with error c(mean(stem2), sqrt(var(stem2))) [1] 12.80000 24.77185 # Sample median and sample MAD of original sample c(median(stem1), mad(stem1, constant = 1)) [1] 5.6 2.3 # Sample median and sample MAD of sample with error c(median(stem2), mad(stem2, constant = 1)) [1] 5.6 2.3 # See lecture slides or textbook for full solutions
